result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas Richard Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Douglas Richard Carter, in custody, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.
Jury trial - 12 person at 01-25-2016 08:30 am

Final pre-trial at 12-07-2015 02:10 pm.
Jury trial at 02-23-2016 08:30 am.

Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Douglas Richard Carter, appeared by video from Clark County Jail with Attorney Christine Kuczynski appearing in person in court.  Jury trial scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 02:10 pm.
Status conference at 11-09-2015 01:50 pm

Prosecuting Atty Lyndsey A.B. Brunette appeared for State of Wisconsin., Defendant, Douglas Richard Carter, appeared via video from Clark County Jail with Attorney Christine Kuczynski appearing in court  Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:50 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 09-29-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 10-15-2015 01:10 pm.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Kuczynski appearing in person in court  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.    The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:10 pm.
Atty Kuczynski
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-17-2015 11:30 am

The defendant shall have no contact with D.K, G.K, S.C. and M.C. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 11:30 am.
